Anteprima Apple Podcasts


 
 

























7 episodi




Green Talking: the podcast helping you learn English for Good! This is the only podcast designed for English language learners, to help you find out more about sustainability and loads of projects creating positive impact across the globe.

We help you improve your English by talking about a range of environmental and social issues such as food, fashion, digital waste and sustainable cities. Each episode is linked to a United Nations Sustainable Development Goal. We want to help you improve your English language skills, and at the same time, learn about the importance of creating a better world, and what we all can do to contribute. This podcast is hosted by Jennifer Ramsay, founder of Green Talk, and Cassie Howe. To learn more about Green Talk visit www.greentalk.fr

                    Istruzione
                  


 





 




 








Green Talking: the podcast helping you learn English for Good! This is the only podcast designed for English language learners, to help you find out more about sustainability and loads of projects creating positive impact across the globe.

We help you improve your English by talking about a range of environmental and social issues such as food, fashion, digital waste and sustainable cities. Each episode is linked to a United Nations Sustainable Development Goal.

We want to help you improve your English language skills, and at the same time, learn about the importance of creating a better world, and what we all can do to contribute. This podcast is hosted by Jennifer Ramsay, founder of Green Talk, and Cassie Howe. To learn more about Green Talk visit www.greentalk.fr








 




 










30 NOV 2020

 

          Sustainable Travel
        


Sustainable Travel



Today we are going to talk about sustainable travel and the impact of our transport choices. Both of us are big fans of travel and the educational and cultural value that it offers, but how do we balance that with the environmental impact?Join us for the last episode of Season 1 of Green Talking! 16 min
 

 







15 NOV 2020

 

          COP26 and Sustainability in Scotland
        


COP26 and Sustainability in Scotland



Today we are going to talk about COP 26 and sustainability in Scotland. This topic links in many ways to the United Nations Sustainable Development Goal 17: Partnership for the Goals.

16 min
 

 







2 NOV 2020

 

          Fast Fashion
        


Fast Fashion



Today we are going to talk about fast fashion and the impact our clothing choices. This session links to United Nations Sustainable Development Goal 12: Responsible Consumption and Production.

13 min
 

 







19 OTT 2020

 

          Sustainable Cities
        


Sustainable Cities



Today we are talking about town planning, smart cities, and our urban areas of tomorrow. This session links to the United Nations Sustainable Development Goal Eleven – Sustainable Cities and Communities. The goal is to make cities inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable. You can find further information about what was discussed today at www.greentalk.fr




17 min
 

 







5 OTT 2020

 

          Digital Waste
        


Digital Waste



Today we are going to talk about digital waste. This session links to the United Nations Sustainable Development Goal 9: Industries, Infrastructure and Innovation, and also Goal 12: Responsible Production and Consumption. You can find further information about what was discussed today, including the full transcript, at www.greentalk.fr.

17 min
 

 







20 SET 2020

 

          Carbon Impact of Food
        


Carbon Impact of Food



Today we are going to talk about the carbon footprint of food and making sustainable food choices. This session links to the United Nations Sustainable Development Goal 12: Responsible Consumption and Production.

We will be looking at this goal a few times during our podcast because it is one of the most important goals for Green Talk. You can find further information about what was discussed today, links to all the projects and the transcript to follow along at www.greentalk.fr/podcast-food




16 min
